channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Home Depot accused of faking Black Friday deals by masking original prices with holiday sale stickers showing the same cost
item.description: The retailer hasn’t responded, but the alleged “pricing shenanigans” are just the latest example of how some shoppers think Black Friday is a farce.

item.title: Dow closes above 45,000 for first time — prompting rethink of market milestones
Europe has caught a workplace absenteeism bug, turning one of the continent’s biggest advantages into a multi-billion euro strain
item.description: The factors driving sick leave culture differs depending on where you look, but are linked to mental health, welfare benefits, and cultural factors.

item.title: Bond ‘vigilantes’ target France after government toppled by no-confidence vote
Crypto prices soar as Trump’s SEC pick stokes hope for more ETFs
China warns against ‘worship’ of chasing faster economic growth
item.description: “If we do not get rid of the ‘worship of speed’ mindset...we will be taking an overdraft from the future,” the official Xinhua News Agency wrote in a ...

item.title: Bitcoin breaks $100,000 as the crypto market aims to redefine itself under Trump
10 semiconductor stocks that might make you a lot of money in 2025
64-year-old Simon Cowell, who doesn’t work Fridays, says he’s ‘not going to bet the house’ on Gen Zers who refuse to take calls over the weekend
item.description: 64-year-old Cowell has quit Fridays, answering late emails, and his phone in search of a better work-life balance, but doesn't expect Gen Z to do the ...

item.title: Europe’s billionaires—who pay their family office CEOs just $370,000 a year—are worried they can’t find the talent to manage their fortunes
item.description: Europe's ultra-wealthy need to find staff from outside the family as younger generations forge their own path.
